name: Devilled Fish
description: Spicy fried fish tossed in a tangy, chili‑garlic sauce.

name: Sri Lankan Chicken Cutlet
description: Breaded chicken patty spiced with curry leaves, green chilies and pepper.

name: Plantain Chips
description: Thinly sliced green plantains deep‑fried to crisp perfection, lightly salted.

name: Sri Lankan Spring Roll
description: Golden fried rolls filled with spiced potatoes, carrots and pea sprouts.

name: Ambul Thiyal (Sour Fish Curry)
description: Firm fish cooked with goraka (a sour fruit), black pepper, and coconut.

name: Egg Hoppers (Biththara Appa)
description: Bowl‑shaped fermented rice flour pancakes topped with a runny egg.

name: String Hoppers (Idiyappam)
description: Steamed rice noodle nests served with coconut sambol and curry.

name: Pol Sambol
description: Freshly grated coconut mixed with red chili, lime, and Maldive fish.

name: Gotu Kola Sambol
description: Chopped Gotu Kola (centella asiatica) tossed with coconut, onions, and lime.

name: Kottu Roti
description: Chopped roti stir‑fried with veggies, eggs and your choice of chicken, beef or shrimp.

name: Plain Hoppers (Appa)
description: Crispy‑edged, bowl‑shaped pancakes made from fermented rice flour and coconut milk.

name: Lamprais
description: Dutch‑inspired rice baked in a banana leaf with meatballs, smoked pork, chicken, and a rich gravy.

name: Sri Lankan Rice & Curry
description: Steamed white rice served with a selection of vegetable, lentil, and meat curries.

name: Chicken Curry
description: Tender chicken pieces cooked in a fragrant blend of coconut milk, cinnamon, and cardamom.

name: Mutton Curry
description: Slow‑cooked lamb shoulder with Sri Lankan spices, tomatoes and coconut milk.

name: Dhal Curry (Parippu)
description: Yellow lentils simmered with mustard seeds, curry leaves and a touch of tamarind.

name: Fish Curry
description: Firm white fish cooked in a spicy coconut‑based gravy with fenugreek and tamarind.

name: Pepper Crab
description: Fresh mud crab sautéed in a rich black pepper and onion sauce.

name: Eggplant Moju
description: Slices of fried eggplant in a sweet‑sour vinegar‑spice glaze.

name: Prawn Sambal
description: Spicy sautéed prawns with onions, tomatoes, chilies and coconut flakes.

name: Watalappan
description: Silky caramel custard flavored with coconut milk, jaggery, cardamom and cashews.

name: Aluwa
description: Jaggery‑sweetened coconut fudge, often cut into diamond shapes.

name: Kokis
description: Crispy, patterned rice flour cookies made in a special iron mould and fried in coconut oil.

name: Thala Guli
description: Sesame seed balls rolled in coconut, honey and cardamom – a traditional energy bite.

name: Kalu Dodol
description: Rich, dark caramelized sweet made from jaggery, sticky rice flour and coconut milk.
